alert.note: Alert for Onondaga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued November 28 at 2:57AM EST until November 29 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 7 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will create areas of blowing snow this afternoon into tonight. * WHERE...Onondaga county. * WHEN...From 10 AM this morning to 7 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snowfall will occur this afternoon into tonight. The higher snowfall amounts are expected to occur in north-central portions of Onondaga County, including the Syracuse metro.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
